prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a tapered rectangular prism The first part is a tapered rectangular prism. 1. Draw a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.0328, 0.0]. Sketch a rectangle with the following dimensions: 1. Start a line from (0.0, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0) 2. Draw a line from (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.5303) 3. From (0.75, 0.5303) to (0.0, 0.5303) 4. Lastly, from (0.0, 0.5303) to (0.0, 0.0) This is face_1 of the sketch. 2. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 3. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the defined euler angles and translation vector. 4. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.0328 in the normal direction and no extrusion in the opposite direction. Set sketch_scale to 0.75 for this extrusion operation. Part 2: Create an internal cutout Create a rectangular prism with a hollow center. 1. Draw a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.4274]. Sketch a rectangle with the following dimensions: 1. Start a line from (0.0, 0.0) to (0.2278, 0.0) 2. Draw a line from (0.2278, 0.0) to (0.2278, 0.0512) 3. From (0.2278, 0.0512) to (0.0, 0.0512) 4. Lastly, from (0.0, 0.0512) to (0.0, 0.0) This is face_1 of the sketch. 2. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.2278. 3. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the defined euler angles and translation vector. 4. For the extrusion operation, perform a cut with an extrusion depth of 0.0631 in the opposite direction of the normal. Set sketch_scale to 0.2278 for this operation. Part 3: Create an additional internal cutout Create an additional hollow area in the object. 1. Draw a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.5392, 0.0, 0.4288]. Sketch a rectangle with the following dimensions: 1. Start a line from (0.0, 0.0) to (0.2101, 0.0) 2. Draw a line from (0.2101, 0.0) to (0.2101, 0.0498) 3. From (0.2101, 0.0498) to (0.0, 0.0498) 4. Lastly, from (0.0, 0.0498) to (0.0, 0.0) This is face_1 of the sketch. 2. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.2101. 3. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the defined euler angles and translation vector. 4. For the extrusion operation, perform a cut with an extrusion depth of 0.0631 in the opposite direction of the normal. Set sketch_scale to 0.2101 for this operation. After all three parts are constructed, the resulting model will represent the final shape described in the provided information.</description>
